      • executeUserAccessRequest

        public java.lang.String executeUserAccessRequest(WorkflowContext wfc)
                                          throws GeneralException,
                                                 sailpoint.connector.ConnectorException,
                                                 java.rmi.RemoteException
        This library function executes a SAP GRC User Access request GRAC_USER_ACCES_WS. inputs to the requests are basically maps which holds all the simple and complex data function prepares the request and fires a call to SAM GRC to execute the request Web service returns a request number back if request call is successful.
        Parameters:
        wfc - Workflow Context.
        Returns:
        Request number generated by SAP GRC Access Request.
        Throws:
        GeneralException, - ConnectorException, RemoteException
        GeneralException
        sailpoint.connector.ConnectorException
        java.rmi.RemoteException

      • getAuditLogDetails

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> getAuditLogDetails(WorkflowContext wfc)
                                                                    throws GeneralException
        Function to get audit logs in map format .This will be called by "SAP GRC Request executor" work-flow
        Parameters:
        wfc - This input parameter will be the object of WorkflowContext.
        Returns:
        Map Map will return in the form of as key,value.
        Throws:
        GeneralException

      • checkRequestDetails

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> checkRequestDetails(WorkflowContext wfc)
                                                                     throws GeneralException
        Method checks the status of request executing at SAP GRC side. and returns the result object containing the status and other fields.

        Based on the status of the request we proceed or terminate the IdentityIQ's access request for the same. Some possible exit cases can be of following :-

        1) Request is rejected request status is FAILED.

        2) Request is partially approved request status is PARTIAL_OK.

        3) Any change in the requested items request status is OK but start_date, end_date, or provisioning action are different for the requested item or any new roles are added or existing assignments are removed.

        4) No role owner is assigned for the requested role. request status is PENDING and current stage status is empty.

        5) Request is forwarded from security stage to manager stage request status is empty and current stage status is ERROR.

        Parameters:
        wfc - - The workflow context.
        Returns:
        requestStatusMap Map holds response of the the user access request.
        Throws:
        GeneralException

        public mc_style.functions.soap.sap.document.sap_com.GracIdmReqDetailsServicesResponse getRequestDetailResponse(WorkflowContext wfc)

      • updateGRCResponse

        public ApprovalSet updateGRCResponse(WorkflowContext wfc)
                              throws GeneralException
        Update GRC response in this request. If GRC has rejected this request, we need to cancel an entire cart. Build our own transient approval set from the grc response. Reject all items if grc rejects ANY item. Add any comments from GRC response in IdentityRequest.

        In future, we need to reject only selected grc items.

        Parameters:
        wfc - Workflow Context.
        Returns:
        Modified approvalSet.
        Throws:
        GeneralException

      • getAuditLogMap

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> getAuditLogMap(WorkflowContext wfc)
                                                                throws GeneralException
        A library function which execute the audit log details and returns the map. containing the all audit information.
        Parameters:
        wfc - Workflow Context object.
        Returns:
        Map of audit information.
        Throws:
        GeneralException

      • addSimulationObject

        public void addSimulationObject(java.lang.String type,
                       java.lang.String roleName,
                       java.lang.String action,
                       java.lang.String connectorName,
                       mc_style.functions.soap.sap.document.sap_com.GracTWsSimulation simulationGracT)
        This function fills the Simulation object based on how the IIQ request is. Entitlements are set based on the operation performed on them i.e. Add or Remove.
        Parameters:
        type - This indicates type of the entitlement (ROL/PRF) requested.
        roleName - Name of the item.
        action - Operation performed on the item.
        connectorName - SAP GRC Connector Name.
        simulationGracT - Simulation container object.

      • checkGRCViolations

        public boolean checkGRCViolations(WorkflowContext wfc,
                         mc_style.functions.soap.sap.document.sap_com.ServiceStub serviceStub)
                           throws java.rmi.RemoteException,
                                  GeneralException
        This method will prepare the request envolope with different mandatory paramaters which are required for execution of web service GRAC_IDM_RISK_WOUT_NO_SERVICES
        Parameters:
        WorkflowContext - wfc :- workflow context
        ServiceStub - ServiceStub :- object of stub class of web service GRAC_IDM_RISK_WOUT_NO_SERVICES
        Returns:
        boolean this will detect the risk is there or not.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException
        GeneralException
